Posts.Content: Jun 23, 2009 07:14AM MissyKWVURN wrote: The thing is, I guess I'm just being paranoid about what people are going to think of my oncologist referring to this as a "pre-cancer" because I am at one of the top ranked hospitals in the country, West Virginia University. We have received many awards, including Magnet Status, and only 2% of hospitals in the country receive award. I'm not trying to be biased because I'm an RN there, but I KNOW I'm in excellent hands. The surgeon who is performing my bi-lateral mastectomy specializes in breast surgery. I love her! She's very caring and understanding, and totally agrees with my decision to do the bi-lateral mastectomy. Also, my oncologist did not tell me DCIS isn't cancer, she said it's referred to as a pre-cancer because it's "in-situ". I guess it's just a matter of the terminology an oncologist uses to describe it. My sister was diagnosed 4 months ago w/DCIS, had a bi-lateral mastectomy at the end of March, and is "all clear" waiting to go for her exchange surgery on August 7th. I'm going to be going through the same treatment regime for mine as she did with hers. Her oncologist referred to it as breast cancer, though.
Posts.Title: Debate about DCIS! MissyKWVURN MissyKWVURN

Posts.Content: MissyKWVURN wrote: Why is it that oncologists refer to this as a "pre-cancer"???? I met with my oncologist today for the first time and she said DCIS is referred to as a "pre-cancer" since it's non-invasive. I called the nurse at the breast care center to confirm what I heard and what I've been reading. Has anyone else on here who had, or has, DCIS been told by their oncologist that DCIS is "pre-cancer". The nurse at the breast care center said it is termed "pre-cancer" or "non-invasive" because it normally does not spread to any other body tissues. I just feel horrible for telling my friends and family I have breast cancer when the oncologist said it's referred to as "pre-cancer"! To me, it's in the duct, which is in my breast. I really feel the information needs to be changed and this should not be considered a "pre-cancer" since anatomically, it IS breast cancer! I fought like a girl and I won!!! LET'S GO MOUNTAINEERS! Dx 6/12/2009, DCIS, 2cm, Stage 0, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Debate about DCIS! MissyKWVURN MissyKWVURN

Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2009 06:11PM MissyKWVURN wrote: Thanks for all of the comments!! I'm having a bilateral mastectomy at the end of July, which both my oncologist and my surgeon are in favor of the decision I've made. :)
Posts.Title: Debate about DCIS! MissyKWVURN MissyKWVURN

Posts.Content: Jun 24, 2009 06:53PM MissyKWVURN wrote: I've calmed down about this. This very site states DCIS is sometimes referred to as "pre-cancer". I'm NOT downing my oncologist for her choice of terms. I have COMPLETE confidence in my oncologist and my surgeons. Thank you all for your imputs!! I really do appreciate it. Like it was said earlier, this is not a competition. We are all here to show love and support for each other as we go through our journeys. :) Â Much Love!!
Posts.Title: Debate about DCIS! MissyKWVURN MissyKWVURN

Posts.Content: MissyKWVURN wrote: I was just diagnosed this past Friday, June 12th. I have DCIS stage 0. I'm awaiting the grade and if it's horomone receptive or not. My sister, who is just 10 years older than me, had the same thing, same breast within the last 6 months. I've chosen to undergo a bilateral mastectomy. My surgery is going to be at the end of July. I'm scared to death. I live in West Virginia, and my whole family is 5 hours away in Pennsylvania. I have a great support system down here. I just need to hear other stories of hope and encourgement. I've chosen to "Fight Like a Girl" and do all I can to beat this. Any positive words and encourgement would really help me right now! Thanks!! I fought like a girl and I won!!! LET'S GO MOUNTAINEERS! Dx 6/12/2009, DCIS, 2cm, Stage 0, Grade 1, 0/4 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed-feeling overwhelmed MissyKWVURN Deb-from-Ohio

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2009 07:24PM MissyKWVURN wrote: WOW!!! I am so excited to see these responses so soon!! It just goes to show how much love and support is shown on this site! The nurse at the Breast Care Center highly recommended this site when I was diagnosed on Friday. I'm still awaiting the rest of the results as far as grade and whether or not it's horomone receptive. I'm very confident I'm in the best place I can be in right now. I'll update when I get more details. THANKS SO MUCH Ladies for all of the replies. I appreciate it very much!! Until next time...... ~Missy K~
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed-feeling overwhelmed MissyKWVURN Deb-from-Ohio
